text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
Jobseekers, this one’s for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-up… the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isn’t about you or your skills. It’s about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesn’t acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe. 🌻
author: Muskan Handa

text: Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you’re just left ghosted.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn’t even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?
author: Muskan Handa

text:
Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!
author: Muskan Handa

text:
Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasn’t nothing. It was the Universe’s way of saying, “Not this one, something better is on the way.”

Every single time, I’ve been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things don’t go as planned, I don’t panic.

I don’t question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you can’t see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. 

Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. 

According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter. 

Your mental health matters more than any job.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
Sometimes, we forget that a company’s brand name doesn’t define someone’s talent. It’s easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

I’ve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They don’t need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side too—people in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

Let’s stop attaching someone’s value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear this—skills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth don’t come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.
author: Muskan Handa

text:
So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good 

I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. 

If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :(
)

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under 

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)
author: Muskan Handa

text: Success is built on consistency. Even on days when motivation is low, showing up and putting in the effort makes all the difference over time.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: In any journey, there will be moments of self-doubt. What matters is how you respond to those moments. Instead of questioning your ability, focus on your preparation. Hard work has a way of building quiet confidence, and that confidence helps you move forward even when the path feels uncertain.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Discipline is doing what needs to be done, even when no one is watching.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: When you start young, you often dream about achieving big things quickly. But over time, you realize that greatness is not achieved in a rush. It is built slowly—through practice, patience, learning from mistakes, and respecting the process. The journey teaches you far more than the destination ever will.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: A strong mindset is just as important as strong skills. Train both with equal dedication.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Teamwork teaches you humility. You begin to understand that individual success is meaningful only when it contributes to the collective goal. Supporting others, trusting their abilities, and celebrating shared achievements create bonds that last far beyond any single victory.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Preparation may not always be visible, but it is always valuable.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: There will be phases when results don’t reflect your effort. These are the times that test your character. Stay committed, analyze what can be improved, and continue working with sincerity. Progress often happens silently, before it becomes visible to the world.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Never stop being a student. The moment you think you know everything, growth stops.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Pressure is something everyone experiences, whether in sports, studies, or work. Instead of fearing it, learn to prepare so thoroughly that pressure becomes an opportunity to perform. When you trust your preparation, you begin to enjoy challenges rather than avoid them.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Respect your craft, stay grounded, and let your work speak louder than words.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: A fulfilling career is not defined only by achievements, but by the values you carry along the way. Integrity, humility, and perseverance shape not just your success, but also the way people remember you. Focus on becoming better each day, and the milestones will follow naturally.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: The future doesn’t just happen on its own. It is built by people who are willing to take risks, question assumptions, and work relentlessly to turn ideas into reality. If something is important enough, you pursue it even when the odds are not in your favor.
author: Elon Musk

text: Innovation is not about following trends; it is about solving problems that truly matter. The goal should always be to create something useful for humanity, not just something impressive.
author: Elon Musk

text: Failure is part of experimentation. If you are not failing occasionally, you are probably not trying anything bold enough. Each failure carries information that helps refine the next attempt.
author: Elon Musk

text: Work with people who share a sense of mission. When a team believes in what they are building, long hours feel like progress rather than pressure.
author: Elon Musk

text: Great products come from first-principles thinking—breaking problems down to their fundamentals and rebuilding solutions from the ground up instead of copying what already exists.
author: Elon Musk

text: Sometimes the most revolutionary step is simply asking, ‘Why must it be done this way?’ That question has the power to reshape entire industries.
author: Elon Musk

text: It is often in the quiet moments, sitting under a tree or listening to the rain, that we rediscover the simple joys we tend to overlook in busy lives.
author: Ruskin Bond

text: Mountains have a way of teaching patience. They do not hurry, yet they change with every season, reminding us that growth can be slow and still be beautiful.
author: Ruskin Bond

text: A good book, a cup of tea, and the sound of birds in the distance can sometimes offer more comfort than the grandest of adventures.
author: Ruskin Bond

text: Nature never demands attention, yet it quietly offers companionship to those willing to pause and observe. In its silence, we often find clarity.
author: Ruskin Bond

text: Stories are everywhere—in small towns, narrow paths, old houses, and familiar faces. One only needs to slow down enough to notice them.
author: Ruskin Bond

text: Happiness is rarely found in dramatic moments. More often, it lives in ordinary days, gentle conversations, and memories that return unexpectedly.
author: Ruskin Bond
